15#include "common_audio/include/audio_util.h"
16#include "modules/audio_processing/agc2/agc2_common.h"
17#include "modules/audio_processing/logging/apm_data_dumper.h"
18#include "rtc_base/checks.h"

23namespace webrtc {
24namespace {
25
26constexpr int kHeadroomHistogramMin = 0;
27constexpr int kHeadroomHistogramMax = 50;
28
29// This function maps input level to desired applied gain. We want to
30// boost the signal so that peaks are at -kHeadroomDbfs. We can't
31// apply more than kMaxGainDb gain.
32float ComputeGainDb(float input_level_dbfs) {
33 // If the level is very low, boost it as much as we can.
34 if (input_level_dbfs < -(kHeadroomDbfs + kMaxGainDb)) {
35 return kMaxGainDb;
36 }
37 // We expect to end up here most of the time: the level is below
38 // -headroom, but we can boost it to -headroom.
39 if (input_level_dbfs < -kHeadroomDbfs) {
40 return -kHeadroomDbfs - input_level_dbfs;
41 }
42 // Otherwise, the level is too high and we can't boost.
43 RTC_DCHECK_GE(input_level_dbfs, -kHeadroomDbfs);
44 return 0.f;
45}
46
47// Returns `target_gain` if the output noise level is below
48// `max_output_noise_level_dbfs`; otherwise returns a capped gain so that the
49// output noise level equals `max_output_noise_level_dbfs`.
50float LimitGainByNoise(float target_gain,
51 float input_noise_level_dbfs,
52 float max_output_noise_level_dbfs,
53 ApmDataDumper& apm_data_dumper) {
54 const float max_allowed_gain_db =
55 max_output_noise_level_dbfs - input_noise_level_dbfs;
56 apm_data_dumper.DumpRaw("agc2_adaptive_gain_applier_max_allowed_gain_db",
57 max_allowed_gain_db);
58 return std::min(target_gain, std::max(max_allowed_gain_db, 0.f));
59}
60
61float LimitGainByLowConfidence(float target_gain,
62 float last_gain,
63 float limiter_audio_level_dbfs,
64 bool estimate_is_confident) {
65 if (estimate_is_confident ||
66 limiter_audio_level_dbfs <= kLimiterThresholdForAgcGainDbfs) {
67 return target_gain;
68 }
69 const float limiter_level_before_gain = limiter_audio_level_dbfs - last_gain;
70
71 // Compute a new gain so that `limiter_level_before_gain` + `new_target_gain`
72 // is not great than `kLimiterThresholdForAgcGainDbfs`.
73 const float new_target_gain = std::max(
74 kLimiterThresholdForAgcGainDbfs - limiter_level_before_gain, 0.f);
75 return std::min(new_target_gain, target_gain);
76}
77
78// Computes how the gain should change during this frame.
79// Return the gain difference in db to 'last_gain_db'.
80float ComputeGainChangeThisFrameDb(float target_gain_db,
81 float last_gain_db,
82 bool gain_increase_allowed,
83 float max_gain_decrease_db,
84 float max_gain_increase_db) {
85 RTC_DCHECK_GT(max_gain_decrease_db, 0);
86 RTC_DCHECK_GT(max_gain_increase_db, 0);
87 float target_gain_difference_db = target_gain_db - last_gain_db;
88 if (!gain_increase_allowed) {
89 target_gain_difference_db = std::min(target_gain_difference_db, 0.f);
90 }
91 return rtc::SafeClamp(target_gain_difference_db, -max_gain_decrease_db,
92 max_gain_increase_db);
93}
94
95// Copies the (multichannel) audio samples from `src` into `dst`.
96void CopyAudio(AudioFrameView<const float> src,
97 std::vector<std::vector<float>>& dst) {
98 RTC_DCHECK_GT(src.num_channels(), 0);
99 RTC_DCHECK_GT(src.samples_per_channel(), 0);
100 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(dst.size(), src.num_channels());
101 for (size_t c = 0; c < src.num_channels(); ++c) {
102 rtc::ArrayView<const float> channel_view = src.channel(c);
103 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(channel_view.size(), src.samples_per_channel());
104 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(dst[c].size(), src.samples_per_channel());
105 std::copy(channel_view.begin(), channel_view.end(), dst[c].begin());
106 }
107}
108
109} // namespace
110
111AdaptiveDigitalGainApplier::AdaptiveDigitalGainApplier(
112 ApmDataDumper* apm_data_dumper,
113 int adjacent_speech_frames_threshold,
114 float max_gain_change_db_per_second,
115 float max_output_noise_level_dbfs,
116 bool dry_run)
117 : apm_data_dumper_(apm_data_dumper),
118 gain_applier_(
119 /*hard_clip_samples=*/false,
120 /*initial_gain_factor=*/DbToRatio(kInitialAdaptiveDigitalGainDb)),
121 adjacent_speech_frames_threshold_(adjacent_speech_frames_threshold),
122 max_gain_change_db_per_10ms_(max_gain_change_db_per_second *
123 kFrameDurationMs / 1000.f),
124 max_output_noise_level_dbfs_(max_output_noise_level_dbfs),
125 dry_run_(dry_run),
126 calls_since_last_gain_log_(0),
127 frames_to_gain_increase_allowed_(adjacent_speech_frames_threshold_),
128 last_gain_db_(kInitialAdaptiveDigitalGainDb) {
129 RTC_DCHECK_GT(max_gain_change_db_per_second, 0.0f);
130 RTC_DCHECK_GE(frames_to_gain_increase_allowed_, 1);
131 RTC_DCHECK_GE(max_output_noise_level_dbfs_, -90.0f);
132 RTC_DCHECK_LE(max_output_noise_level_dbfs_, 0.0f);
133 Initialize(/*sample_rate_hz=*/48000, /*num_channels=*/1);
134}
135
136void AdaptiveDigitalGainApplier::Initialize(int sample_rate_hz,
137 int num_channels) {
138 if (!dry_run_) {
139 return;
140 }
141 RTC_DCHECK_GT(sample_rate_hz, 0);
142 RTC_DCHECK_GT(num_channels, 0);
143 int frame_size = rtc::CheckedDivExact(sample_rate_hz, 100);
144 bool sample_rate_changed =
145 dry_run_frame_.empty() || // Handle initialization.
146 dry_run_frame_[0].size() != static_cast<size_t>(frame_size);
147 bool num_channels_changed =
148 dry_run_channels_.size() != static_cast<size_t>(num_channels);
149 if (sample_rate_changed || num_channels_changed) {
150 // Resize the multichannel audio vector and update the channel pointers.
151 dry_run_frame_.resize(num_channels);
152 dry_run_channels_.resize(num_channels);
153 for (int c = 0; c < num_channels; ++c) {
154 dry_run_frame_[c].resize(frame_size);
155 dry_run_channels_[c] = dry_run_frame_[c].data();
156 }
157 }
158}
159
160void AdaptiveDigitalGainApplier::Process(const FrameInfo& info,
161 AudioFrameView<float> frame) {
162 RTC_DCHECK_GE(info.speech_level_dbfs, -150.f);
163 RTC_DCHECK_GE(frame.num_channels(), 1);
164 RTC_DCHECK(
165 frame.samples_per_channel() == 80 || frame.samples_per_channel() == 160 ||
166 frame.samples_per_channel() == 320 || frame.samples_per_channel() == 480)
167 << "`frame` does not look like a 10 ms frame for an APM supported sample "
168 "rate";
169
170 // Compute the input level used to select the desired gain.
171 RTC_DCHECK_GT(info.headroom_db, 0.0f);
172 const float input_level_dbfs = info.speech_level_dbfs + info.headroom_db;
173
174 const float target_gain_db = LimitGainByLowConfidence(
175 LimitGainByNoise(ComputeGainDb(input_level_dbfs), info.noise_rms_dbfs,
176 max_output_noise_level_dbfs_, *apm_data_dumper_),
177 last_gain_db_, info.limiter_envelope_dbfs, info.speech_level_reliable);
178
179 // Forbid increasing the gain until enough adjacent speech frames are
180 // observed.
181 bool first_confident_speech_frame = false;
182 if (info.speech_probability < kVadConfidenceThreshold) {
183 frames_to_gain_increase_allowed_ = adjacent_speech_frames_threshold_;
184 } else if (frames_to_gain_increase_allowed_ > 0) {
185 frames_to_gain_increase_allowed_--;
186 first_confident_speech_frame = frames_to_gain_increase_allowed_ == 0;
187 }
188 apm_data_dumper_->DumpRaw(
189 "agc2_adaptive_gain_applier_frames_to_gain_increase_allowed",
190 frames_to_gain_increase_allowed_);
191
192 const bool gain_increase_allowed = frames_to_gain_increase_allowed_ == 0;
193
194 float max_gain_increase_db = max_gain_change_db_per_10ms_;
195 if (first_confident_speech_frame) {
196 // No gain increase happened while waiting for a long enough speech
197 // sequence. Therefore, temporarily allow a faster gain increase.
198 RTC_DCHECK(gain_increase_allowed);
199 max_gain_increase_db *= adjacent_speech_frames_threshold_;
200 }
201
202 const float gain_change_this_frame_db = ComputeGainChangeThisFrameDb(
203 target_gain_db, last_gain_db_, gain_increase_allowed,
204 /*max_gain_decrease_db=*/max_gain_change_db_per_10ms_,
205 max_gain_increase_db);
206
207 apm_data_dumper_->DumpRaw("agc2_adaptive_gain_applier_want_to_change_by_db",
208 target_gain_db - last_gain_db_);
209 apm_data_dumper_->DumpRaw("agc2_adaptive_gain_applier_will_change_by_db",
210 gain_change_this_frame_db);
211
212 // Optimization: avoid calling math functions if gain does not
213 // change.
214 if (gain_change_this_frame_db != 0.f) {
215 gain_applier_.SetGainFactor(
216 DbToRatio(last_gain_db_ + gain_change_this_frame_db));
217 }
218
219 // Modify `frame` only if not running in "dry run" mode.
220 if (!dry_run_) {
221 gain_applier_.ApplyGain(frame);
222 } else {
223 // Copy `frame` so that `ApplyGain()` is called (on a copy).
224 CopyAudio(frame, dry_run_frame_);
225 RTC_DCHECK(!dry_run_channels_.empty());
226 AudioFrameView<float> frame_copy(&dry_run_channels_[0],
227 frame.num_channels(),
228 frame.samples_per_channel());
229 gain_applier_.ApplyGain(frame_copy);
230 }
231
232 // Remember that the gain has changed for the next iteration.
233 last_gain_db_ = last_gain_db_ + gain_change_this_frame_db;
234 apm_data_dumper_->DumpRaw("agc2_adaptive_gain_applier_applied_gain_db",
235 last_gain_db_);
236
237 // Log every 10 seconds.
238 calls_since_last_gain_log_++;
239 if (calls_since_last_gain_log_ == 1000) {
240 calls_since_last_gain_log_ = 0;
241 RTC_HISTOGRAM_COUNTS_LINEAR("WebRTC.Audio.Agc2.EstimatedSpeechLevel",
242 -info.speech_level_dbfs, 0, 100, 101);
243 RTC_HISTOGRAM_COUNTS_LINEAR("WebRTC.Audio.Agc2.EstimatedNoiseLevel",
244 -info.noise_rms_dbfs, 0, 100, 101);
245 RTC_HISTOGRAM_COUNTS_LINEAR(
246 "WebRTC.Audio.Agc2.Headroom", info.headroom_db, kHeadroomHistogramMin,
247 kHeadroomHistogramMax,
248 kHeadroomHistogramMax - kHeadroomHistogramMin + 1);
249 RTC_HISTOGRAM_COUNTS_LINEAR("WebRTC.Audio.Agc2.DigitalGainApplied",
250 last_gain_db_, 0, kMaxGainDb, kMaxGainDb + 1);
251 RTC_LOG(LS_INFO) << "AGC2 adaptive digital"
252 << " | speech_dbfs: " << info.speech_level_dbfs
253 << " | noise_dbfs: " << info.noise_rms_dbfs
254 << " | headroom_db: " << info.headroom_db
255 << " | gain_db: " << last_gain_db_;
256 }
257}
